definition: laurel/victory garland (in Greek and Western culture)
surname Gui/abbr. for Guangxi Autonomous Region 廣西壯族自治區|广西壮族自治区[Guang3 xi1 Zhuang4 zu2 Zi4 zhi4 qu1]
to put on a hat/to be first/to dub
laurel crown/victory garland (in Greek and Western culture)
Kim KyeGwan (1943-), North Korean diplomat, vice-foreign minister of

sentences.english: The bay-crown's shade, Beloved, I surmise.
sentences.chinese: 愛，我猜度月桂冠的濃蔭。

sentences.english: Because of his long-term unremitting efforts, he finally won his the laurel of "The Sage of Calligraphy".
sentences.chinese: 長期堅持不懈的努力，終於使他贏得“書聖”的桂冠。

sentences.english: I plucked all the blossom in my garden into wreaths.
sentences.chinese: 我摘下我花園中所有的嬌豔，把它們織成各個桂冠們。

sentences.english: You want to win and comrade-in-arms with the crown the god of war you?
sentences.chinese: 你想和戰友一起摘取戰地之神的桂冠嗎？

sentences.english: Our company is the one producing "Guiguan" brand series quartz clock.
sentences.chinese: 本公司是以生產“桂冠”牌系列石英鐘的企業。

sentences.english: It is unclear what specific proposals the two envoys will discuss.
sentences.chinese: 目前還不清楚希爾和金桂冠會討論什麼具體建議。

sentences.english: So now , crowned goddess, I make this vow.
sentences.chinese: 所以現在，戴着桂冠的女神，我在此立下誓言。

sentences.english: A man who has won mg laurels can only encourage the brave .
sentences.chinese: 象我這樣贏得了桂冠的人，能給勇敢的人們鼓氣。

sentences.english: Thus the most outstanding poet always desires to be made a poet laureate .
sentences.chinese: 因此最傑出的詩人總希望獲得桂冠詩人的尊號。

sentences.english: There is a title we can't win no matter how hard we might swing.
sentences.chinese: 有一項桂冠我們不能贏得，無論我們如何努力揮拳。

sentences.english: The cogwheel later became a laurel6 wreath.
sentences.chinese: 嵌齒輪後來變爲了一個桂冠。

sentences.english: Gwan - Why gwan determine only 1 core?
sentences.chinese: 金桂冠桂冠確定爲什麼只有1的核心？

sentences.english: Gwan - Why gwan determine only 1 core?
sentences.chinese: 金桂冠桂冠確定爲什麼只有1的核心？

sentences.english: I need not be crowned with a laurel vain;
sentences.chinese: 我就不用戴虛榮的桂冠。

sentences.english: May the wreathes they have won never wither.
sentences.chinese: 願他們贏得的桂冠永不凋零。

definition: to take (after a struggle)/to wrest/to seize/to capture/to win (a trophy)
to continue in a post/(to hold a post) several times in succession/(to win a title) in successive years/to stay at number one/to defend a championship
to aspire to the throne/to aim at (the first place etc)
(of a list, music chart etc) to reach the top
